result.execSummary:
The defendant Trisha J Mohr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
NOTE: If the Defendant's probation is revoked, the conditions of extended supervision shall be the same as the conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs. Court costs are paid in full.
--------------------------------

No contact with co-defendants. No contact with or use of alcohol. No use of illegal drugs. No use of medications without a prescription. Documentation of prescription medications, dosage and prescribing physician to be reported to the Agent.
------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
------------------------------

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before August 21, 2015 @ 8:00 a.m.
